title: Support for friendly_json comment
body:
This will enable the parsing of a flat json marked as `friendly_json`. 

This will also:

* Migrate from `failure` to `this_error`.
* Updated references

This will close #54.

title: Bugfix: comments no longer remove friendly names
body: Fixes #52.

title: Fix incorrect escape in sudoers file
body: Fix #50

title: Docker image without root
body:
Docker container runs with a non root user which has sudo access to run `wg` only.
Refers to #27

title: Remove linux/386 platform from buildx
body: In order for the Docker build to pass as only amd64 is supported for now.

title: Readme docker
body:
- Add Docker badges
- Use pre-built docker image for running it
- Docker image build instructions

title: Added optional sudo to wg command
body: Partially fixes #27.

title: Support for # key values in comment (friendly_name at the moment)
body: This handles #43.

title: Fix latest buildx workflow
body:
- Small copy paste mistake
- Fix #36

title: Docker CI
body:
Refers to #40 

- Simple Docker build for PR to the master branch to verify the build passes
- Docker buildx (for amd64 and 386) with Docker tag `:latest` on changes to the master branch
- Docker buildx (for amd64 and 386) with Docker tag `:<tag name>` on Github releases & tags
- Docker buildx (for amd64 and 386) on branch pushes `:<branch-name>`

**What's left to do**

1. Confirm the Docker Hub username
1. Fix microbadger link once Docker image is up on Docker Hub
1. Add buildx and microbadger docker image badges to readme
1. Support ARM64 builds, not so trivial after all in Rust unfortunately.

title: Dockerize the app!
body:
- Dockerfile + .dockerignore added, with a final 20MB Docker image
- Readme instructions on how to build'n'run

I'm a bit of a Docker maniac and like to run everything in containers (even iptables, not kidding!)

There are just 3 points we should address:

1. Maybe we can move that Docker section somewhere else in the readme
1. Do you have a Docker Hub account? If so, I can set up some Docker build pipeline with Github Actions so users can just pull the image, as building it is time consuming. It might even be possible to compile for all CPU architectures too (i.e. ARM etc.).
1. I noticed the program won't exit on CTRL-C at least in the container (tested on 2 machines). Is there a reason that comes to your mind? Using the Docker `--init` flag allows it to quit gracefully though, but it would be nice not to need it.

Anyway thanks for the great tool 👍

title: Switch from Travis to GitHub actions
Parse case insensitive
body: Fixes #29.

title: Multiple interfaces from command line support
body: Fixes #30.

title: Split interface name from peer configuration file
body:
# Breaking change

Solves https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/22.

This PR adds a `-i` command line parameter that specifies the interface name. Previously it was inferred from the configuration file. If you were using the `-n` flag, please specify the `-i` flag as well to keep the same behaviour.

title: Support for stderr output in TRACE log level
support for ipv6 address in command line
body:
This PR allows the service to listen to IPv6 addresses as well as IPv4.

Addresses https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/23.

title: wrong param for interface
body: Its '-l' instead of '-p'

title: Migrated to std::future
body:
* Updated dependecies
* More verbose logging

title: Strip link-local zone ids from IPv6 socket addrs
body:
:warning: **Caution:** this is just a workaround, not a fix for #10. It may help others who encounter this as well, but I'm **not** sure if we really want to merge and release this patch.

-----

This is a fairly ugly hack to temporarily work around the issue #10.
Until now Rust doesn't support so-called zone-ids[1] in link-local IPv6
socket-addresses and has a pending RFC on this topic. As I'm
encountering this issue on one of my machines I decided to work around
this issue (for now) by removing the zone-id from the IPv6 address.

This won't harm any other cases as `regex.replace_all` simply returns
the input if the regex doesn't match:

```
>> extern crate regex;
>> let re = regex::Regex::new(r"^\[(?P<ip>[A-Fa-f0-9:]+)%(.*)\]:(?P<port>[0-9]+)$");
>> let rs = re.replace_all("fairly unrelated stuff", "[$ip]:$port");
>> rs
"fairly unrelated stuff"
```

Please note that (1) this regex isn't RFC-compliant[2] and is just a
heuristic to remove zone-ids that currently break this exporter and
(2) this is something that probably shouldn't be merged as-is. I mainly
pushed this since I needed a workaround for this issue (and others
probably too), but it may be better to wait for proper support from the
language.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4007#section-11

title: wg show <interface> if specified in the command line
body: This handles the issue [https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/16](https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/16).

title: add ability to specify exporter IP address
body: It'd be nice if users can specify desired IP address that exporter should listen to.

title: swapped rx-tx
body: Fixes [https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/13](https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/13).

title: Export remote information behind optional flag
Expose `remote_ip` and `remote_port` for each WireGuard peer
body: Now each peer also provides the fields `remote_ip` and `remote_port` if available in the output for Prometheus.

title: Replaced local_ip + local_port with allowed_ips
body:
Solves [https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/8](https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/8). Unfortunately this means the Prometheus' labels will have to change. Specifically:

`local_ip` and 'local_port` are replaced by `allowed_ips`. `allowed_ips` is not interpreted in any way: we just pass on the value returned by WireGuard.

title: Exported boilerplate to external crate
Added Travis integration and fixed failing tests
Parse strings using `std::net` to support peers with IPv6 addresses
body:
Also alter datatype for ports to `u16` as tcp port numbers are unsigned
16bit integers.

title: Counters ending in `_total` and timestamps are not interpreted as delta
body: Closes [https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/3](https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/3) and [https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/2](https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/2).

title: Friendly names support for peer names
